tool.name: gmail.fetch_emails
tool.description: Fetches all emails from your Gmail account with options for filtering and pagination.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve emails from the user's Gmail account. You can filter by labels, query terms, and use pagination.

parameters.parameter: Maximum number of results to return.
Query to filter emails (same syntax as Gmail search).
Filter emails by label IDs.
Token for pagination to get the next page of results.

tool.name: gmail.send_email
tool.description: Sends an email using Gmail's API.
tool.usage: Use when the user needs to send an email. You can specify recipients, subject, body content, and attach files.

parameters.parameter: Recipient email address(es), comma separated for multiple.
Email subject line.
Email body content (can include HTML).
Carbon copy recipients, comma separated.
Blind carbon copy recipients, comma separated.
List of attachment objects (not implemented yet).

tool.name: gmail.fetch_message_by_thread_id
tool.description: Fetches messages by thread ID from Gmail with pagination support.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve all messages in a specific email thread or conversation.

parameters.parameter: The Gmail thread ID to fetch.
Maximum number of messages to return.
Token for pagination to get the next page of results.

tool.name: gmail.fetch_message_by_message_id
tool.description: Fetches a specific message by its message ID from Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve details of a specific email when you have its message ID.

parameters.parameter: The Gmail message ID to fetch.

tool.name: gmail.get_attachment
tool.description: Gets an attachment from a specific email message.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve a file attachment from an email.

parameters.parameter: The message ID containing the attachment.
The attachment ID within the message.

tool.name: gmail.get_profile
tool.description: Gets the profile information of the authenticated Gmail user.
tool.usage: Use when you need to verify the user's Gmail identity or retrieve their email address and profile details.

tool.name: gmail.create_email_draft
tool.description: Creates a draft email in Gmail without sending it.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to prepare an email but save it as a draft rather than sending immediately.

parameters.parameter: Recipient email address(es), comma separated for multiple.
Email subject line.
Email body content (can include HTML).
Carbon copy recipients, comma separated.
Blind carbon copy recipients, comma separated.

tool.name: gmail.reply_to_thread
tool.description: Replies to an email thread in Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to respond to an existing email conversation.

parameters.parameter: The ID of the thread to reply to.
Content of the reply message.

tool.name: gmail.modify_thread_labels
tool.description: Modifies labels of a thread in Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when you need to add or remove labels from an entire email conversation.

parameters.parameter: The ID of the thread to modify.
Array of label IDs to add to the thread.
Array of label IDs to remove from the thread.

tool.name: gmail.list_labels
tool.description: Lists all labels in the user's Gmail account.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve the available labels to filter or organize emails.

tool.name: gmail.list_threads
tool.description: Lists email threads in Gmail with pagination support.
tool.usage: Use when you want to retrieve email threads rather than individual messages.

parameters.parameter: Maximum number of threads to return.
Query to filter threads (same syntax as Gmail search).
Filter threads by label IDs.
Token for pagination to get the next page of results.

tool.name: gmail.add_label_to_email
tool.description: Adds a label to a specific email in Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when you need to categorize or tag an individual email message.

parameters.parameter: The ID of the message to label.
Array of label IDs to add to the message.

tool.name: gmail.create_label
tool.description: Creates a new label in Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to create a custom label for organizing emails.

parameters.parameter: Name for the new label.
Visibility in the label list (labelShow/labelShowIfUnread/labelHide).
Visibility in the message list (show/hide).
Background color (hex code).
Text color (hex code).

tool.name: gmail.search_people
tool.description: Searches for contacts in the user's Google Contacts that match a query.
tool.usage: Use when you need to find contact information for people in the user's Google Contacts.

parameters.parameter: Search query to match against contacts.
Fields to include in the response.
Number of results per page.
Token for pagination.

tool.name: gmail.get_people
tool.description: Gets detailed information about specific contacts.
tool.usage: Use when you need detailed information about one or more specific contacts.

parameters.parameter: Array of resource names (contact IDs) to retrieve.
Comma-separated list of person fields to include.

tool.name: gmail.get_contacts
tool.description: Gets a list of the user's contacts saved in Google Contacts.
tool.usage: Use when you need to retrieve all or a filtered list of the user's contacts.

parameters.parameter: Number of contacts to return per page.
Token for pagination to get the next page.
Fields to include in the response.

tool.name: gmail.remove_label
tool.description: Removes a label from Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to delete a custom label they no longer need.

parameters.parameter: ID of the label to remove.

tool.name: gmail.delete_draft
tool.description: Deletes an email draft from Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to discard a draft email.

parameters.parameter: ID of the draft to delete.

tool.name: gmail.delete_message
tool.description: Permanently deletes an email message from Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to permanently delete an email (bypassing trash).

parameters.parameter: ID of the message to delete.

tool.name: gmail.list_drafts
tool.description: Lists all email drafts in the user's Gmail account.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to see their saved draft emails.

parameters.parameter: Maximum number of drafts to return.
Token for pagination.
Query to filter drafts (Gmail search syntax).

tool.name: gmail.move_to_trash
tool.description: Moves an email message to the trash in Gmail.
tool.usage: Use when the user wants to trash an email instead of permanently deleting it.

parameters.parameter: ID of the message to move to trash.
